snippet: As New York’s leader confronts declining approval ratings, more police and city workers will be given the task of responding to a growing problem.
abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de BLasio unveils new plan to address street homelessness, which has emerged as political crisis for his administration; plan will use canvassing strategy similar to that used by Police Dept to map and document crime.

byline.original: By MICHAEL M. GRYNBAUM and NIKITA STEWART

lead_paragraph: As New York’s leader confronts declining approval ratings, more police and city workers will be given the task of responding to a growing problem.

headline.main: Mayor de Blasio, Facing Homelessness Crisis, Issues Plan to Fight It
headline.print_headline: Mayor, Facing Homelessness Crisis, Issues Plan to Fight It
